summary.p: This commentary on the Amarakośa is also known as the Padakaumudī or the Amarapañjikā, by Nārāyaṇacakravartin, whose family name was Pūṭatuṇḍa (Shastri 1931, 304). According to Eggeling (1887, 272), it was composed in Śāka 1540 (1619 CE).

The colophon gives the name of the scribe, Raghunandana, the owner, Rāyagovinda, and a Śāka date, 1648 (1726/1727 CE). There is a third name, of a reader, appended to the end of the colophon, but it is unclear.
